item.title: Report E-2024010454
item.description:
Report E-2024010454

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-30T15:10:41+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-22
  • City: MOUNT VERNON
  • State: KY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal XLX experienced a customer location release of UN1170 Ethanol during unloading. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 15 gallons of product released to an 8’ x 10’ area of the trailer floor. Due to the material evaporating prior to their arrival, there was no release to clean. The damaged drum was placed into a 95-gallon poly overpack. The waste was then transported to the XPO terminal in Lexington, KY and staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report E-2024010470
item.description:
Report E-2024010470

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-30T15:10:41+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-16
  • City: SULPHUR
  • State: KY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: CLEAN HARBORS ENVIRONMENTAL SERVICES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: The driver was traveling on I-71WB in KY when a passer by flagged him down. He then pulled off at the Sulfur Ky exit and inspected his load he noticed a frozen material at the back door of the trailer. The driver then grabbed some absorbent to put down at the back of the trailer to prevent material from getting on the ground. The driver then called our emergency line at 1351ET to report the incident. The team was dispatched and arrived at 1745ET to start the clean up. The team dawned the proper PPE and proceeded to clean up the frozen material at the back of the trailer. There was aprxemetly 1-2oz that made it to the ground everything else was contained to the trailer and absorbent wags. Once that was cleaned they opened the trailer and found material frozen on the floor and proceeded to clean it up. They then gained access to the drum that was about half way in the trailer and found that the bottom of the drum has approximately 1in crack at the bottom. The team put the damaged container into a salvage drum along with absorbents used to clean up the material. The team was able to finish the clean up around 0100ET.

item.title: Report X-2024010515
item.description:
Report X-2024010515

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-29T15:11:25+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-11
  • City: LOUISVILLE
  • State: KY
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: AT THE UPS WORLDPORT FACILITY IN LOUISVILLE, KY AN AIR PACKAGE WET FROM RAINWATER WAS BEING REWRAPPED WHEN AN INNER BOX WAS FOUND WITH A UN3481 LITHIUM BATTERY MARK. UPON FURTHER INSPECTION OF THE INNER CONTENTS DISCOVERED THREE LITHIUM ION BATTERIES CONTAINED IN EQUIPMENT. THERE IS ONE HP OFFICE JET 200 MOBILE PRINTER WITH A UN3481 LABEL ON THE CONSUMER PACKAGING. THERE IS A LITHIUM-ION BATTERY PACK ATTACHED TO THE PRINTER, MODEL NUMBER CZ993-60017. THERE IS ANOTHER BOX INSIDE THE PACKAGE THAT CONTAINS ONE PANASONIC TOUGHBOOK WITH TWO ATTACHED LITHIUM-ION BATTERY PACKS, MODEL NUMBER FZ-VSU1HU. THERE ARE ALSO ADDITIONAL NON-DANGEROUS GOODS ITEMS INSIDE THE PACKAGE. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER BOX TO INDICATE LITHIUM ION BATTERIES CONTAINED IN EQUIPMENT PRODUCTS WERE BEING SHIPPED IN THE AIR NETWORK. PRIOR TO DISCOVERY THE PACKAGE WAS FLOWN ON UPS AIRCRAFT FROM ATL TO SDF.

  • Description: AT THE UPS WORLDPORT FACILITY IN LOUISVILLE, KY RESPONDED TO AN AIR PACKAGE THAT NEEDED TO BE REWRAPPED. UPON INSPECTION OF THE CONTENTS DISCOVERED APPROXIMATELY 2 KGS OF DRY ICE PELLETS COOLING FOOD SAMPLES. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER BOX. THIS PACKAGE WAS SHIPPED FROM TEXAS USING UPS ACCOUNT NUMBER 1Y75A7, WHATABURGER RESTUARANTS LP, 610 W SUNSET RD., SAN ANTONIO TX 78216-6907.

  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was found by an admin during a dock walk. Package was sitting in a tote with signs of leakage. Unsure how it occurred. Package was brought back to QA for inspection. DescribePack: Package was opened and it was found that the usual thing happened with this package. Cap came loose on part A of contents. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was kept in lined tote and cap was tightend.

item.title: Report E-2023120219
item.description:
Report E-2023120219

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-02T00:33:30+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-22
  • City: LIVINGSTON
  • State: KY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: CSX TRANSPORTATION, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 1
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On 11/22/2023, at approximately 13:51 hours, CSX train M54121 derailed at milepost 00C 138.8. As a result of the derailment two tank cars containing sulfur breached and released their contents which caught fire. Additionally, an empty tank car, which last contained methanol, was determined to have breached. Multiple other rail cars containing non-regulated materials also breached and released contents- some of which caught fire. The shippers of hazardous materials (loaded and residue shipments) were notified via CHEMTREC (Report #2023-11-22-00172). Multiple response contractors, as well as CSX Hazardous Materials Team personnel, were responded to the incident emergently. CSX and contractor personnel contained the fire and releases, as well as remediated the environmental impact. Due to air quality concerns from the fire, local responders recommended that residents in the area of the derailment site evacuate. This recommended evacuation applied to a single residence shortly after the derailment occurred and continued to expand for several hours until it included the entire town of Livingston, KY. On 11/23/2023, at 16:00 hours, response officials lifted the evacuation.
